title: Rules of procedure in House and Senate

content.question: Which of the following statements about rules of procedure in the House and Senate is correct?

choices.label: Debate by a determined minority in either chamber cannot be halted.
The rules in each chamber are determined by the majority whip.
The rules are specified in Article I of the Constitution.
The rules can be changed by the President during a national emergency.
The House operates more by formal rules, while the Senate operates more on informal understandings.

content.answer: The House operates more by formal rules, while the Senate operates more on informal understandings.
